title: iOS CRDT file path structure doesn't match desktop - iOS writes to SD/notes/noteId.yjs but desktop writes to SD/notes/noteId/clientId_docId_timestamp-counter.yjson. This breaks sync between platforms.
description:
## Current iOS Behavior (WRONG)

**Path**: `SD/notes/noteId.yjs`
**Code**: EditorViewModel.swift:62

## Correct Desktop Behavior

**Path**: `SD/notes/noteId/updates/instanceId_noteId_timestamp-sequence.yjson`

### Detailed Structure

Desktop creates this directory hierarchy per note:
- `SD/notes/noteId/updates/` - Update files
- `SD/notes/noteId/snapshots/` - Snapshot files  
- `SD/notes/noteId/packs/` - Packed updates
- `SD/notes/noteId/meta/` - Metadata

### Filename Format

Desktop: \`instanceId_noteId_timestamp-sequence.yjson\`

Example: \`ab04da9a-7b4e-4a33-837d-886d70a7f1db_bc79c37b-8108-4bcd-a1da-8e684488b29c_1763219787329-129.yjson\`

Where:
- \`instanceId\`: Client/instance UUID
- \`noteId\`: Note UUID
- \`timestamp\`: Unix timestamp in milliseconds
- \`sequence\`: Monotonic sequence number per note
- Extension: \`.yjson\` (not \`.yjs\`)

### Required iOS Changes

1. Update EditorViewModel.swift to use correct path structure
2. Implement instance ID generation for iOS client
3. Implement sequence number tracking per note
4. Use generateUpdateFilename() logic from desktop
5. Write to notes/noteId/updates/ directory
6. Update FileChangeProcessor to read from correct paths
7. Migrate existing .yjs files to new structure

### Reference Files

- packages/shared/src/crdt/update-format.ts:127-150 (generateUpdateFilename)
- packages/shared/src/storage/sd-structure.ts:37-46 (getNotePaths)
- packages/shared/src/storage/update-manager.ts:97-119 (writeNoteUpdate)

title: Fix iOS ↔ Desktop cross-platform sync
description:
**Problem:**
Manual testing revealed that iOS and Desktop cannot sync changes with each other:
- Desktop → iOS: Desktop notes don't appear in iOS
- iOS → Desktop: iOS notes appear as 'Untitled' and blank in Desktop

**Root cause:**
iOS is missing ActivityLogger integration. Desktop uses activity logs to track which notes changed, but iOS:
1. Doesn't write activity logs when creating/editing notes
2. Doesn't read activity logs to discover Desktop changes

**What was done:**
- ✅ Created proper e2e test (RealWorldCrossPlatformTests.swift)
- ✅ Implemented ActivityLogger for iOS (commit 40ec9d1)
- ✅ Added FileChangeProcessor.scanStorageDirectory()

**Remaining work:**
See child issues for details

**Test plan:**
1. Run RealWorldCrossPlatformTests - all should pass
2. Manual testing:
   - Create note in Desktop → verify appears in iOS
   - Create note in iOS → verify appears in Desktop
   - Edit note in Desktop → verify iOS sees changes
   - Edit note in iOS → verify Desktop sees changes

**Context:**
- E2E test: packages/ios/Tests/RealWorldCrossPlatformTests.swift
- ActivityLogger: packages/ios/Sources/Storage/ActivityLogger.swift
- Manual test results documented in session

title: Fix UUID case mismatch between iOS and Desktop
description:
iOS creates uppercase UUIDs, Desktop creates lowercase. This could cause lookup issues.

**Current behavior:**
- iOS: F931030E-DF9C-4C4C-901F-8C3EE15B3DEC
- Desktop: ac5912fb-1033-436f-8944-b4201639c6d1

**Decision needed:**
Choose one approach:
1. **Standardize to lowercase** (recommended - matches Desktop)
2. Standardize to uppercase
3. Make lookups case-insensitive (more complex)

**If choosing lowercase (recommended):**
- iOS: Change UUID().uuidString to UUID().uuidString.lowercased()
- Search for all UUID().uuidString calls
- Update instance ID generation
- Update note ID generation

**Files to check:**
- Sources/Storage/ActivityLogger.swift (instance ID)
- Anywhere notes are created
- Search for: UUID().uuidString

**Test:**
Manual testing - verify iOS and Desktop can both read each other's notes
Check that file/directory names match case

title: Make iOS read activity logs to discover Desktop changes
description:
iOS needs to read activity logs from other instances (Desktop) to discover which notes have changed.

**What needs to be done:**
- In FileChangeProcessor.scanStorageDirectory(), read activity logs first
- Use ActivityLogger.readAllActivity() to get changed notes
- Process only the notes listed in activity logs (optimization)
- Fall back to full directory scan if no activity logs exist

**Algorithm:**
1. Check if .activity directory exists
2. Read all *.log files using ActivityLogger.readAllActivity()
3. For each note in activity logs, load its updates
4. Also check for notes not in activity logs (initial sync)

**Files to modify:**
- Sources/Storage/FileChangeProcessor.swift

**Test:**
Run RealWorldCrossPlatformTests.testIOSDiscoversDesktopNote - should pass after this fix

**Context:**
See ActivityLogger.readAllActivity() for reading logs
Desktop writes activity logs when saving notes

title: iOS: Tags should be in CRDT document, not separate database
description:
iOS tags stored in SQLite correctly, but missing automatic extraction from content.

ACTUAL DESKTOP BEHAVIOR (not as originally described):
- Desktop does NOT store tags in CRDT metadata
- Desktop extracts hashtags from content text using regex: /#[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*/g
- Tags are indexed in SQLite (same schema approach as iOS)
- Tags auto-update whenever note content changes

CURRENT iOS PROBLEMS:
1. No automatic tag extraction from note content
2. Tags must be manually created/linked (not hashtag-based)
3. No re-indexing when EditorViewModel saves content
4. No re-indexing when FileChangeProcessor syncs from disk

FIX NEEDED:
1. Port extractTags() from packages/shared/src/utils/tag-extractor.ts to Swift
2. Add tag extraction to EditorViewModel.handleUpdate()
3. Add tag extraction to FileChangeProcessor.processChangedFiles()
4. Extract plain text from Yjs content (walk Y.XmlFragment tree)

Database schema is already correct - just needs extraction logic wired up.
